_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The two extremes [sn12.46:4.3]: The person who does the deed experiences the result
One person does the deed and another experiences the result
The middle way [sn12.46:4.3]: Ignorance is a condition for choices
Choices are a condition for consciousness
That is how this entire mass of suffering originates
When ignorance fades away and ceases with nothing left over, choices cease
When choices cease, that is how this entire mass of suffering ceases
